helper_functions module¶

helper_functions.authenticate_extract_lyrics(GCS_API_KEY, GCS_ENGINE_ID)[source]¶

Function to initialize the lyrics_extractor class and to authenticate the google custom search engine.

Parameters

  • GCS_API_KEY (str) – Google cloud service API key

  • GCS_ENGINE_ID (str) – Google custom search engine ID

Returns

Songlyrics object

helper_functions.authenticate_spotify_api(SPOTIPY_CLIENT_ID, SPOTIPY_CLIENT_SECRET)[source]¶

Function to authenticate the Spotify API with client credentials flow manager.

Parameters

  • SPOTIPY_CLIENT_ID (str) – public Spotify API key

  • SPOTIPY_CLIENT_SECRET (str) – private Spotify API key

  • SPOTIPY_REDIRECT_URI (link) – Link to which Spotify API is set in Spotify Dashboard

Returns

Spotify API client

helper_functions.clean_lyrics(data)[source]¶

Function to clean the lyrics. It lowercases the lyrics, tokenizes it and removes all stopwords.

Parameters

data (list) – list of strings of song lyrics

Returns

(list) list of tokenized and clean lyrics

helper_functions.create_playlist(user_id, sp, recommendations, name, description)[source]¶

Function to create a playlist on the Spotify account of the authenticated user.

Parameters

  • sp (object) – spotipy.Spotify object initialized and authenticated with authenticate_spotify_api()

  • recommendations (DataFrame) – DataFrame of recommendations, output of recommender.content_based_recommender().

  • name (str) – Name of the playlist.

  • description (str) – Description of the playlist.

Returns

(str) succes/error message

helper_functions.download_nltk()[source]¶

Function to download the nltk stopwords, necessary for downloading them in deployed streamlit.

helper_functions.get_img_urls(track_ids, sp)[source]¶

Function to get the album image urls from tracks with the Spotify API, given a list of track id’s.

Parameters

  • track_ids (list) – Spotify track id’s

  • sp (object) – spotipy.Spotify object initialized and authenticated with authenticate_spotify_api()

Returns

(href) URL’s to album images from Spotify API

helper_functions.load_data_csv()[source]¶

Create dataframes for the song data and the id lookup table from csv files.

Returns

(Pandas DataFrame) Pandas DataFrame of song data and lookup table

helper_functions.load_data_sql()[source]¶

Create dataframes for the song data and the id lookup table from sql tables

Parameters

conn (MySQL connection) – connection to MySQL server

Returns

(Pandas DataFrame) Pandas DataFrame of song data and lookup table

helper_functions.radar_chart(song, dataset)[source]¶

Function to make a radar chart of the audio features of a song.

Parameters

  • song (DataFrame) – Pandas dataframe with the audio features of a song

  • dataset (DataFrame) – Pandas dataframe with the database of songs we use to make recommendations. Used for normalizing the audio features (tempo and loudness) of the song.

Returns

plotly-express radar chart figure

helper_functions.search_multiple_tracks(search_query, sp)[source]¶

Function to return the top 10 Spotify track id’s, track name and artist given a search querry.

Parameters

  • search_quear – search query / search term

  • sp (object) – spotipy.Spotify object initialized and authenticated with authenticate_spotify_api()

Returns

(dict) Dictionary with track names, artists and id’s

helper_functions.tag_lyrics(data)[source]¶

Function to tag every document. Needed as input for the Doc2Vec network.

Parameters

data (list) – list of cleaned lyrics (output of the clean_lyrics function)

Returns

(list) list of tagged lyrics
